Mick Aston soon finds ample clues such as the remnants of millstreams used to power grindstones that suggest their theory is correct, but a problem arises when one of their finds does not fit in with the story.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdom's bizarre hybrids, including the 'pizzly bear', a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the world of rodents, whose constantly growing incisor teeth are used to chisel through any obstacle and range from squirrels and the English harvest mouse to the large South American capybara. He looks at examples of their dental prowess, showing how agoutis in Panama break open rock-hard nutshells and the skills employed by beavers in Wyoming as they fell massive trees to build dams rivalling feats of human engineering.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate Gateholm Island, off the coast of Pembrokeshire, where a number of mysterious artefacts were discovered some time ago, suggesting the site was once of religious importance. The only way to get to the island is by rigging a 500-metre zip wire way above the wave-lashed rocks. The archaeologists battle inclement weather to begin a dig on the mainland, where team leader Francis Pryor sees characteristics suggestive of a classic Iron Age fort beginning to emerge.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team descend on Bitterley, Shropshire, where local headmistress Jane Bishop has been leading an exploration of a field, which locals believe used to be the site of houses and streets. The villagers begin to excavate test pits in their own gardens to help the professionals, but it is three days before their answer is revealed.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the hunting tactics of the world's carnivores. Arctic foxes in the frozen north must collect food during warmer times to survive the winter, while the big cats of the southern hemisphere rely on stealth and surprise to catch each meal. The presenter also reveals how leopards and tigers are solitary hunters, coming together only to mate, whereas lions stay in family groups so they can tackle larger prey and better protect their young.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: In the second programme, the historian explores how science and detection influenced the popular culture of murder during Victorian times. Writers including Charles Dickens and Wilkie Collins were fascinated by grisly crimes, and the literary genre that came out of it captured the imagination of readers. The presenter also reveals that when Jack the Ripper began his reign of terror in London at the same time Robert Louis Stevenson's Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde was published, the idea of the serial killer was introduced to the British public.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the secretive Rosicrucian Order, whose members included Leonardo Da Vinci and Isaac Newton.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston journeys to Greece and Italy to uncover the truth about oracles - mythical figures who could reputedly hear and speak to gods.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the theory that Nazis were engaged in building spacecraft before the outbreak of the Second World War.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live on the coast, including sea lions working in packs to hunt tuna in the shallows and moray eels that venture out of the water to seek out food on dry rocks. Puffins must brave predators to bring a mouthful of food back to their young and king penguins go without food for a month while they moult. Plus, footage of the bizarre Leaping Blenny, a fish that hates the water.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fears her true identity as an undercover reporter could be blown when a journalist visits Sun Hill, while Jim decides to follow a psychic's advice and propose to June. Sheelagh is mortified to see her son arrested for a homophobic hate crime and Lance is furious at Adam for revealing he's gay, while Steve and Cameron find the dead body of a young thug - could he be the latest victim of Gabriel's vigilante campaign?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Consumed by her desire for revenge, Kerry confronts Gabriel and tells him she intends to prove he's the serial rapist. He isn't remotely fazed by her threats, however, and continues to goad Cameron, provoking a violent outburst in the canteen. Rob pursues his vendetta against the Radford clan by making a rash accusation, and Sheelagh finally loses patience with Lance's persistent hints that her son might be gay.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel demands Cameron be expelled from Sun Hill following the canteen brawl and it seems only Kerry's testimony can save him - but it's doubtful she'll be willing to speak out after jeopardising the hunt for the serial rapist. As the pressure mounts on Cameron, he decides to throw in the towel and return to Australia, leading to an emotional confrontation with his ex-fiancee. Meanwhile, Gina fears Jonathan Fox's passion for her is cooling and Neil becomes increasingly attracted to Andrea - but will he realise she's an undercover reporter?.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: As a grief-stricken Vic and Lucy struggle to come to terms with Peggy's death, life goes on at the health centre, where a man turns nasty when his wife refuses to continue her IVF treatment. Meanwhile, Karen joins the team, but isn't exactly welcomed with open arms, while her husband David starts work at the Goddard's. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash..

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Tension mounts between Karen and Jacqui, and an elderly patient confides in Chris, while David comes t o Henry's aid at Goddard's - much to Simon's displeasure. Elsewhere, a patient suspected of having cancer tries to persuade his daughter to accept the new love in his life.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny returns from her stint at the London Hospital and heads straight into one of the most emotive cases of her career when she and Sister Evangelina assist at the birth of a baby with spina bifida. As the parents struggle to come to terms with their son's life-limiting condition, Jenny, who has never delivered a disabled child, also fails to comprehend the far-reaching implications for the family. Meanwhile, Nonnatus House plays host to an acquaintance of Chummy - the Rev Applebee Thornton, an eccentric cleric who befriends Jane. Jessica Raine, Pam Ferris and Dorothy Atkinson star, with a guest appearance by Jason Watkins (Trollied).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The locals excitedly prepare for the summer fete, featuring a baby show for which Trixie volunteers to secure a celebrity judge. Not everyone is in the mood for a party, however, as Jenny finds when she meets Nora Harding, a mother-of-eight distraught that she will soon have another mouth to feed. The midwife does her best to reassure the desperate mum, but her words fall on deaf ears and Nora ends up taking matters into her own hands. Jessica Raine and Helen George star, with a guest appearance by Sharon Small (Mistresses).

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the mystery drama. The sleuthing senior citizen is urged by an old friend to visit her sister as she is convinced something is wrong. Miss Marple heads for the country to investigate and it is not long before a heated argument in a locked room ends with a gunshot that leaves a man dead. Jean Simmons and Joss Ackland guest star, with Joan Hickson.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective takes on his most challenging case as he searches for Linda's father-in-law, with the only clue to his whereabouts being an incident on board a submarine 25 years ago. As the case takes a devastating turn, Wallander is plunged into the shady world of Cold War-era politics and faces a battle to protect his daughter. Final episode of the crime drama, starring Kenneth Branagh.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a children's home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. When an artist's impression of a skeleton found in an archaeological dig matches one of the youngsters, the team tries to determine the identity of the paedophile. Starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers decide to go to a local brothel in Hong Kong, but the visit has unforeseen consequences. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colonel Fortune is worried about the prospect of merging with another regiment, and Second Lieutenant Kate Butler faces hostility from the Marines during an exercise.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom and Ed put Chrissie's loyalty to the test as Zubin and Ric investigate the heart transplant incident - which someone is going to have to take responsibility for. Diane reaches a milestone, Lisa anxiously waits to hear about her promotion and the secrets that have been building up over the past few months finally erupt following an attempt to separate conjoined twins.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Alan Kennedy is in custody but the Sun Hill coppers will soon have to release him unless they can find some hard evidence linking him to the rapes. Determined to extract a confession, Samantha resorts to the unorthodox psychological technique of donning a mini-skirt and revealing blouse - will it be enough to make him crack? Elsewhere, tragedy strikes as Adam attends a summer party held to improve community relations.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant has reservations about abandoning his holiday with Sharon at the last minute, but is determined to show he puts her wishes first.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur Fowler was never too happy at Pete Beale billeted on his family, but is Arthur's life going to get any better without him?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve, Jude finds her locker broken into and all her credit cards and money taken. It transpires the thief is Matt's father, and he implores her not to involve the police. Elsewhere, Daniel gets himself into Mike's bad books for queue-hopping one of the patients from a fund-holding GP.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie enters the political arena, but a murder soon stops his campaign dead in its tracks. Jersey-based detective drama, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The department store starts an insurance scheme, prompting the staff to get in shape for the medical. Comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike and the team are reacquainted with some familiar faces when investigating a suspicious suicide at the Brokenwood Women's Prison.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 16-year-old case of an infamous getaway driver convicted of murdering his wife when new evidence suggests it could have been a miscarriage of justice. But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company is sent to New Zealand for a training exercise, where Paddy and Dave take a new recruit under their wing. Guest starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy, Dave and Vinny have a romantic reunion with their wives before the day of exercise with live ammunition begins. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will questions Zubin's handling of Tom's dismissal during an operation, accusing him of back-stabbing, and Donna is surprised by how seriously Lisa takes her new responsibilities. On the anniversary of baby Amanda's death, Mubbs tells Chrissie the identity of the father, while Diane reveals to Owen that she has been raped in the past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde is determined to leave the country - but he is not leaving without Kofi.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle and Rachel find themselves in trouble when Clyde's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A young boy needs his stomach pumped after swallowing his grandmother's anti-depression pills, and Kate finds herself arbitrating between his warring relatives. Protestors gather outside the hospital to stage a demonstration against Holby Healthcare Trust's investment in an armaments company.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: The French police ask Jim to investigate the murder of a Jersey resident in their country. The victim is Jack Moberley, a private eye trailing an eccentric lawyer at the time of his death. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey goes to inform Martina that the family will be holidaying in Rome for the Christmas period.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's flat is occupied by squatters - so young Mr Grace allows her to stay in a showcase apartment in the store. Classic comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and Harold Bennett.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is asked to give evidence at the appeal of convicted murderer David Bennetto, and when her testimony leads to his release, she ends up locking horns with DI Rachel Klein, who put the man away six years earlier. It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? Emilia Fox stars, with appearances from Tobias Menzies, Michael Socha and Aaron McCusker.

programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rageh Omaar presents reports from around the world. Paul Davies returns to Bucharest 30 years after reporting on the Romanian revolution, John Irvine reports on an unusual solution to a lack of available burial space in Jerusalem - a six-storey underground cemetery, and Penny Marshall visits safe houses and drug rehab centres run by a British Christian missionary in South Africa.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests tennis champion Andy Murray, Luke Evans, recently seen in Second World War drama Midway, doctor-turned-comic and author of bestseller This is Going to Hurt Adam Kay, and comedian Desiree Burch.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers arrive in Scarborough, North Yorkshire, where Corrie Jeffrey is sunk by an ill-fated ship painting and Alison Chapman is dazzled by a diamond brooch. Meanwhile, Tony Geering is in for an epic battle over a huge collection of comic books.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Labour Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Graham's plan is thwarted, Wendy is grateful, and Laurel and Jai are cautiously optimistic.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bernie takes the law into her own hands to punish Kel, and the police question Robert about Vicky's disappearance. Meanwhile, Derek turns up at Gary's shop in desperate need of cash.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Leader Interviews: Boris Johnson - Tonight
programme.desc: With the General Election just days away, Julie Etchingham scrutinises Prime Minister Boris Johnson's time so far in office, examining his vision for the country and plans for Brexit.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul accuses Bernie of jeopardising the case against Kel, and Carla informs the police of Robert's violent past. Meanwhile, Rita realises that she is surplus to requirements.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec provide coverage of the latest stage in the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials in a bid to be crowned King or Queen of the Jungle. Which of them will start to crack under the pressure?.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men to enter the 'love lift' are a Bruno Mars impersonator, a duck lover, a serial dater and a skip driver, who pull out all the stops in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Holiday camp entertainers The Hi-De-His from Somerset take on The Wolf Pack from Wolverhampton, battling it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, hosts Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom offer the most successful group a chance to win up to 40,000

programme.desc: With the General Election just days away, Julie Etchingham scrutinises Prime Minister Boris Johnson's time so far in office, examining his vision for the country and plans for Brexit.

programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Far Out There
programme.desc: The team members think that they are facing a new Sykronian weapon when a vortex appears in the sky over Enchanted Island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes Mrs. Wicket's house-mate when he suffers a flea infestation. Will they get on?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
programme.sub-title: Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy: The Thanos Threat
programme.desc: When Thanos, Ronan, Nebula and the Ravagers seek to possess powerful and creative relic, the fate of the universe depends on the Guardians of the Galaxy to protect it.

programme.title: Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Vambre and Prohyas return to Adventure Academy where Professor Cyrus sends them on a quest to find the Legendary Knowledge Magisword..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: With West End and Strictly Come Dancing star Danny Mac, and chef Nick Nairn. Plus, Dylan Watkins shows how to make gourmet dinners for dogs, and wine maestro Oz Clarke taste-tests more of the best wines on the supermarket shelves.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are starting to feel festive with a few winter warmers. Lisa begins with a blue cheese and butternut squash pie, followed by John's sausage casserole. They also serve a family favourite - macaroni cheese, with a twist - and for dessert it's a classic ginger cake served two ways.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by Asimakis Chaniotis, London's youngest Michelin-starred chef, to create a family feast from Greece. The menu starts with scrambled eggs for breakfast and chicken gyros for lunch. Then Asimakis rustles up his mum's meatball soup for dinner before Nadia makes Greek almond crescent biscuits for dessert.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits the jewel of the Italian Riviera - the Cinque Terre - five towns that are only accessible by boat or train. He begins in the smallest town, Corniglia, where he meets an opera-singing florist, before hopping on the train to Manarola and the dry-stone wallers responsible for keeping the towns from crumbling into the sea. As he heads toward the end, he also heading to Vernazza, Gino meets wine producers who scale 1,000m above sea level to tend to their vines.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A petty thief is impaled with a pitchfork in sleepy Midsomer Mallow, jeopardising the residents' chances of winning a 'perfect village' competition. To make matters worse, two of the judges are also killed. Murder mystery, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey, Timothy West and Maggie Steed, along with an appearance by Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Bentley, mechanic David, army paramedic Nick and dancer Josh enter the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Host Paddy McGuinness presides over the matching process, and also catches up on the latest developments from all the couples in Fernando's as the dating game bows out for another series.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Actress Sally Phillips, musician Rick Wakeman, professional snowboarder Jenny Jones and impressionist Alistair McGowan pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser, as Bradley Walsh hosts another star-studded edition of the show. The celebrities must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec present the celebrity challenge, as the famous faces' ordeal in the Australian jungle draws close to its conclusion. The pair offer viewers one last chance to catch up with the remaining contestants, all of whom will have their hearts set on being named King or Queen of the Jungle.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: A special appearance by one of the most famous bands in the history of music, The Who, chatting and performing in the studio ahead of their first new album in 13 years. Also appearing are The Grand Tour and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Jeremy Clarkson, and Bafta-nominated actor Samson Kayo.

programme.title: Play to the Whistle
programme.desc: Host Holly Willoughby keeps captains Frank Lampard and Bradley Walsh in check, with guests including GB hockey Olympic gold medallist Sam Quek, sports presenter Jake Humphrey and comedian Rob Beckett. Also providing the laughs are comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Seann Walsh.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: Nature documentary revealing how animals cope with the demands of raising their offspring. The first episode follows newborn lambs and foals as their mothers help them to learn to walk, a gorilla in a safari park going through a difficult birth and a white rhino mutilated by hunters that gives birth to a calf, but will have a hard time protecting it. Plus, a look at how highland cows and pigs nurse their young - and a seal that is not able to. Featuring Adam Henson, narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The bell-ringers of Midsomer Wellow are mysteriously murdered one by one - and it seems an ancient rhyme may hold the key to the killer's motive. As Barnaby and Troy embark on a baffling investigation in an attempt to determine the truth, Joyce starts digging into the past to discover the assassin's motives. John Nettles, Daniel Casey and Hugh Bonneville star.

programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under 15.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which celebrity contestants John Inverdale, Judy Murray, Bernard Cribbins and Scarlett Moffatt pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts an I'm A Celebrity special of the game show. Former campmates Joel Dommett, Dean Gaffney and Rosemary Shrager all try to guess well-known phrases and attempt to win the50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show
programme.desc: In a one-off special recorded at London's Alexandra Palace Theatre, the singer performs classic hits, plus new Christmas songs. He's also joined by guests including David Walliams and Jamie Cullum.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Final
programme.desc: They've survived until the end after enduring Bushtucker Trials, camp life and each other. But which of the finalists will you crown this year's King or Queen of the Jungle? Ant and Dec reveal which of the campmates will follow in the footsteps of 2018 winner Harry Redknapp. It's been a rollercoaster ride of a contest, with highlights including the windy skyscraper challenge on day one, and the moment Jacqueline Jossa had to face her fear of spiders in an early challenge. While Caitlyn Jenner has become a show favourite, it remains to be seen who will emerge from the camp victorious.

programme.title: Hatton Garden: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately 14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. The documentary gains access to the secret surveillance material that put the thieves behind bars and features exclusive interviews with the detectives who cracked the case as well as Kenny Collins, one of the thieves involved.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: This time, the comedian meets an agoraphobic dog who is too scared to go outside, before an unusually quiet chihuahua arrives with a suspected injury to her leg. Later, Paul is introduced to a group of four Japanese chin crosses who have not being getting on well with each other and need to be separated.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland visit Chiddingstone Castle in Kent, where they invite three teams of enthusiasts to compete to find the most rare and valuable items. Whoever wins each round gets first choice in the Masterpiece Challenge, a room filled with antiques, one of which is worth more than 10,000. At the end of the show each team reveals what its members think is the masterpiece and whoever chooses the most masterpieces wins 1,000
